revisions.rev:
{{Infobox artist discography | Artist = [[The Jackson 5]] | Image = | Caption = | Studio = 16 | Live = 3 | Compilation = 15 | EP = | Singles = 51 | Video = | Music videos = 13 | B-sides = | Soundtrack = 2 | References = Yes | Ref link = Notes }} This article presents the '''discography''' of [[United States|American]] [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]]/[[soul music|soul]] [[Musical ensemble|band]] '''[[The Jackson 5]]''' (also spelled '''''The Jackson Five''''', '''''The Jackson 5ive''''', or '''''The Jack5on Five'''''), later known as '''The Jacksons''', is an [[American popular music]] [[Jackson family|family]] [[Musical ensemble|group]] from [[Gary, Indiana]]. Founding group members [[Jackie Jackson|Jackie]], [[Tito Jackson|Tito]], [[Jermaine Jackson|Jermaine]], [[Marlon Jackson|Marlon]] and [[Michael Jackson|Michael]] formed the group after performing in an early incarnation called '''The Jackson Brothers''', which originally consisted of a trio of the three older brothers. Youngest brother [[Randy Jackson (The Jacksons)|Randy Jackson]] joined the group after Jermaine stayed with Motown Records and the brothers went to Epic/CBS Records. Twenty-two of their singles reached the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Billboard Hot 100|Top 40]], with four of them reaching number-one. ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== ====Motown releases (The Jackson 5)==== {|class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"|Year !rowspan="2"|Title !colspan="4"|Peak
